lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
What can I do for you?
String taskString = taskList.addTask(new Event(description, from, to));
public MarkTaskCommand(String[] command, TaskList taskList) throws DukeException {
public static HashMap<String, String> parseArguments(String command, String[] flags) throws DukeException {
public static Command parseCommand(String string, TaskList taskList) {
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
public String setDone(int i, boolean isDone) {
INVALID_COMMAND("Oops... you need to provide a valid command."),
INVALID_FORMAT("Oops... you need to provide only one of each argument"),
INVALID_INDEX("Oops... you need to provide a valid task index"),
MISSING_DESCRIPTION("Oops... you need to provide a description for your task."),
MISSING_INDEX("Oops... you need to provide the index of a task"),
MISSING_TIME("Oops... you need to provide the time(s) for this task");
START ("Hello! I'm Duke" + System.lineSeparator() + "What can I do for you?"),
EXIT  ("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!"),
ADD_TASK   ("Got it. I've added this task:"),
LIST_TASKS ("Here are the tasks in your list:"),
MARK_TASK  ("Nice! I've marked this task as done:"),
UNMARK_TASK("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:"),
TASK_COUNT ("Now you have %d task%s in the list."),
GENERIC_HELP ("Valid commands are: todo, deadline, event, list, mark, unmark, bye");
public static void printAddTaskMessage(String taskString, TaskList taskList) {
public static void printMarkTaskMessage(String taskString, boolean isDone) {
public static void printError(String errorMessage, String command) {
